words.def: Bundle, see fiber bundle.
words.name: Bundle

words.def: Codimension. The codimension of a submanifold is the dimension of the ambient space minus the dimension of the submanifold.
words.name: Codimension

words.def: Cotangent bundle, the vector bundle of cotangent spaces on a manifold.
words.name: Cotangent bundle

words.def:
Diffeomorphism. Given two differentiable manifolds M and N, a bijective map 
  
    
      
        f
      
    
    {\displaystyle f}
  
 from M to N is called a diffeomorphism if both 
  
    
      
        f
        :
        M
        →
        N
      
    
    {\displaystyle f:M\to N}
  
 and its inverse 
  
    
      
        
          f
          
            −
            1
          
        
        :
        N
        →
        M
      
    
    {\displaystyle f^{-1}:N\to M}
  
 are smooth functions.
words.name: Diffeomorphism.

words.def: Doubling, given a manifold M with boundary, doubling is taking two copies of M and identifying their boundaries. As the result we get a manifold without boundary.
words.name: Doubling,

words.def: Fiber. In a fiber bundle, π: E → B the preimage π−1(x) of a point x in the base B is called the fiber over x, often denoted Ex.
words.name: Fiber

words.def: Frame. A frame at a point of a differentiable manifold M is a basis of the tangent space at the point.
words.name: Frame

words.def: Frame bundle, the principal bundle of frames on a smooth manifold.
words.name: Frame bundle

words.def: Lens space. A lens space is a quotient of the 3-sphere (or (2n + 1)-sphere) by a free isometric action of Zk.
words.name: Lens space

words.def: Manifold. A topological manifold is a locally Euclidean Hausdorff space. (In Wikipedia, a manifold need not be paracompact or second-countable.) A Ck manifold is a differentiable manifold whose chart overlap functions are k times continuously differentiable. A C∞ or smooth manifold is a differentiable manifold whose chart overlap functions are infinitely continuously differentiable.
words.name: Manifold

words.def: Neat submanifold. A submanifold whose boundary equals its intersection with the boundary of the manifold into which it is embedded.
words.name: Neat submanifold

words.def: Parallelizable. A smooth manifold is parallelizable if it admits a smooth global frame. This is equivalent to the tangent bundle being trivial.
words.name: Parallelizable

words.def: Principal bundle. A principal bundle is a fiber bundle P → B together with an action on P by a Lie group G that preserves the fibers of P and acts simply transitively on those fibers.
words.name: Principal bundle

words.def: Submanifold, the image of a smooth embedding of a manifold.
words.name: Submanifold

words.def: Surface, a two-dimensional manifold or submanifold.
words.name: Surface

words.def: Systole, least length of a noncontractible loop.
words.name: Systole

words.def: Tangent bundle, the vector bundle of tangent spaces on a differentiable manifold.
words.name: Tangent bundle

words.def: Tangent field, a section of the tangent bundle. Also called a vector field.
words.name: Tangent field

words.def:
Transversality. Two submanifolds M and N intersect transversally if at each point of intersection p their tangent spaces 
  
    
      
        
          T
          
            p
          
        
        (
        M
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle T_{p}(M)}
  
 and 
  
    
      
        
          T
          
            p
          
        
        (
        N
        )
      
    
    {\displaystyle T_{p}(N)}
  
 generate the whole tangent space at p of the total manifold.
words.name: Transversality

words.def: Vector bundle, a fiber bundle whose fibers are vector spaces and whose transition functions are linear maps.
words.name: Vector bundle

words.def: Vector field, a section of a vector bundle. More specifically, a vector field can mean a section of the tangent bundle.
words.name: Vector field

words.def:
Whitney sum. A Whitney sum is an analog of the direct product for vector bundles. Given two vector bundles α and β over the same base B their cartesian product is a vector bundle over B ×B. The diagonal map 
  
    
      
        B
        →
        B
        ×
        B
      
    
    {\displaystyle B\to B\times B}
  
 induces a vector bundle over B called the Whitney sum of these vector bundles and denoted by α⊕β.
words.name: Whitney sum
